version_description:
iPad Support is Here

By pitchforks-and-torches levels of popular demand, Nebula now supports iPadOS. Enjoy your favorite Nebula Originals on your favorite tablet.

Also new in 1.4:

• Fixed a nasty cache bug which led to "no videos found" on the Featured view.
• Overhauled search to be more search-y.
• "All Creators" under "Browse" contains an option for viewing all recent videos.

A couple of secret features:
• Pull to silently refresh the featured view
• Double-tap on the right or left of the player to skip ahead or backwards.


We're working on more, but we wanted to hurry up and ship the iPad version before things got ugly. Thanks for your support, everyone. Enjoy.

Merry Christmas, ya filthy animals. We wanted to get a few fixes and improvements out before we hit the egg nog. New in this release:
• Launch/loading experience is much improved.
• Videos in search are now sorted by date, newest first.
• Airplane mode will no longer sign you out of the app. Sorry, Mick.
• Channel view headers now collapse gracefully, giving more space to the content.
• Fixed an awkward crash when downloading videos.
• Thumbnails load faster.
• Not really an app update but have you seen Working Titles? So great.

Hello darkness, my old friend.

• Dark mode. Total smoke show. You can manually toggle it in settings.
• Optional dark app icon, if you’re into that sort of thing.
• Featured tab now shows the latest videos.
• iOS can now auto-fill your password.

We’ve also dropped iOS 12 support so we can focus on new features. Sorry, iPhone 5 users.

Assorted bug fixes and improvements. Just kidding; here’s what we actually did:

• There’s now a list of Originals right up at the top of the Featured view.
• About screen now supports dark mode.
• “Browse” has been reorganized slightly to make content easier to find.
• Swiping on hero images no longer sends images flying.
• Fixed some SSL errors.
• Fixed disappearing video descriptions when rotating.
• Thomas Frank did an episode of Working Titles and honestly the last four minutes are super weird. We’ll check in on him.

Assorted bug fixes and improvements. Just kidding; here's what we actually did:

1.6.1

• Every Original in the Originals row had the word "Original" so we removed it because it's like okay, we get it, there are lots of Originals.

1.6

• There's now a list of Originals right up at the top of the Featured view.
• About screen now supports dark mode.
• "Browse" has been reorganized slightly to make content easier to find.
• Swiping on hero images no longer sends images flying.
• Fixed some SSL errors.
• Fixed disappearing video descriptions when rotating.
• Thomas Frank did an episode of Working Titles and honestly the last four minutes are super weird. We'll check in on him.
This update is boring. Just a quick fix to help people log out of their account in some circumstances. Sorry to get your hopes up, but don't worry, fun stuff is still on the way.

We're close to the finish line with the Apple TV app, but wanted to sneak out a quick update:

• Support for subtitles. We're still adding them to the videos, but our app is ready.
• You can now contact support from within the app.

We wore masks while we worked on these updates.

• Manuel found a bug in My Shows where a channel doesn’t get properly updated upon refresh. We fixed it.
• Rene got a tweet from “Techinterested1” about our mis-colored player background. We changed it to black.
• Gruber asked us to make the gray channel names darker to improve accessibility. Done.
• Chris noted that our status bar stayed in place even in fullscreen mode on iPad. We fixed that.
• While fixing things for these nice people we spotted some minor UI things and fixed those too.

• Look everyone, keyboard shortcuts for the iPad video player!
• Sometimes the app would crash when loading a video description. We put an end to that nonsense.
• Brave iPadOS beta users noticed that our tab labels were truncated. We fixed that too.

• Added a sneak peek for podcasts. (Feature-length debut forthcoming.)
• Background audio makes its triumphant return for iOS 14 users.
• Downloads were acting out. We've shown them some love and added background support, download progress tracking, and fixed a number of bugs.
• "Bug fixes" and "improvements".

• Nebula Originals and Nebula Plus content are now badged as you browse around your favorite creators, making their exclusive content easier to spot.
• Improved podcast support. You can now browse and listen to podcasts natively within the app.
• A crash could occur in Browse on iPads. That's been fixed.
• Our image caching has been overhauled to address a few related bugs.

• Fixed visual bug in Browse view where cells weren’t highlighting correctly.
• Changes under the hood to prepare for using the new API in the future.
• Fixed a crash that some users were encountering while the app was loading data.
• Remember how the app used to take forever to load? We fixed that. New API. Loads much, MUCH faster than before. Thank you all for being so patient.
